original_title: Sri Lanka Tourism Alliance says online campaign exceeded target
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka Tourism Alliance, an industry association promoting sustainable practices said its online campaign had reached a wider audience that expected.
The campaign started in the fourth quarter of 2022, was to signal that the country had returned to normal and used platforms including Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and Google display advertisements.
Malik Fernando, Chair of the Tourism Alliance said he goal was to reach 1 million potential tourists but almost 6 million were reached, with 31.5 million impressions.

“If only global consumer marketing could be done at country level, positioning Sri Lanka as it truly deserves, the impact on bookings and rates across the spectrum of accommodation would be spectacular,” Fernando said.
The campaign targeted markets including India, Germany, Spain, UK, France and the US.
Sri Lanka welcomed 524,000 tourists by May 2023 and is expecting 2.5 million by the end of the year. (Colombo/Jun11/2023)
